decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [[A-000-001 Rev P0, A-100-097 Rev P0, A-100-098 Rev P0, A-100-099 Rev P0, A-100-000 Rev P1, A-100-001 Rev 0, A-100-002 P0, A-100-003 Rev P0, A-100-004 Rev P0, A-100-005 Rev P0, A-100-006 Rev P0, A 110 001 Rev P1, A 110 002 Rev P1, A 120 001 Rev P1, A 120 002 Rev P1, A 120 003 Rev P1, TM415-L01 Rev A, TM415LS02 Rev B, f PH/19074/101, PH/19074/100, A 100 050 P0, A-100-051 Rev P0, A-100-052 Rev P0, A-110-050 Rev P0, A-000-110 Rev P0, A 120 110 Rev P0]. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 3 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the written scheme of investigation (WSI) detailed in:
- Archaeological Desk-Based Assessment 101a, 111-113 Tooting High Street, London SW17 ref. ALT/RvKM//23714 dated August 2019 by RPS, 
- Cover letter prepared by CGMS Ref: RvKM/23714 dated 04/09/2018, 
- 111-113 Tooting High Street,. SW17 0SU: An Archaeological, Evaluation Site Code:: TON18 dated August 2018 by Pre-Construct Archaeology
For land that is included within the WSI, no demolition or development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed WSI, and the programme and methodology of site evaluation and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works.
Reason: In order that the archaeological remains that may exist on the site can be investigated, in accordance with Council policies DMS2(d).

Condition : 4 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [Historic Buildings Record - 111-113 Tooting High Street, SW17 prepared by CgMs and Archaeology South East dated August 2018, Building Survey Report 101a Tooting High Street, London SW17 0SU ref. EKA170922 Rev A dated 24 July 2019 prepared by Earl Kendrick Associates].
Reason: In order to secure a photographic record of this local historical building, and in accordance with section 12 of the NPPF and policy DMS2.

Condition : 5 - The development shall be carried out with regard to the deskstudy [Phase 1 Environmental Report 111-113, Tooting High Street, LONDON, SW17 0SU  LHG ref. 01B809582  Version dated July 2018] and the addition of a watching brief, to mitigate against the risk that previously unforeseen contamination which in the event of its discovery be dealt with appropriately.  Both the submission of watching brief and potential remediation, shall be undertaken to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To safeguard the public, the environment and surface and groundwater as this site may have or is known to have been used in the past for activities that are likely to have resulted in it being contaminated with material that is potentially harmful to humans, or the environment.

Condition : 6 - The development hereby approved shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the approved  method statement for the reduction of emissions from construction detailed in Air Quality Assessment 101a, 111 - 113 Tooting High Street  ref. 9.009 03 dated April 2020 by XCO2. All mobile vehicles associated with the demolition / construction should comply with the standard of the London Low Emission Zone. (All HDVs/HGVs should aim to be Euro VI compliant for PM because of the intensive and extensive nature of construction in the surrounding area.)
To achieve appropriate sustainability standards in accordance with policy DMS3, London Plan policies 5.3 and 7.14 and NPPF 103 and 181.

Condition : 7 - The development hereby approved shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the approved Dust Management Plan and monitoring detailed in: 111-113 Tooting High Street, London Dust Management Plan Revision B ref. DM/JEB/P18-1531/01 Rev B dated January 2019 prepared by Create Consulting Engineers.
To manage and prevent further deterioration of existing low quality air across London in accordance with London Plan policy 5.3 and 7.14, and NPPF 103 and 181.

Condition : 8 - The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following details: 
- provision of 373 hotel rooms (Class C1), 
- provision of 551sq.m for community use (Class D1/D2) and 
- provision of 651sq.m for publicly accessible open space at ground floor level.
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 9 - The public open space shall be carried out in accordance with the measures detailed in drawings Nos. TM415LS02 B and TM415-L01 A. All planting, seeding, turfing and green roofs included in the approved details shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the development, or in accordance with a programme agreed in writing with the local planning authority.  
To ensure a satisfactory appearance and biodiversity value in the development, in accordance with Council policies DMS1 and DMO4.

Condition : 10 - The proposed levels shall be created in accordance with the approved details: 025 010 Rev P0 and A 100 050 P0 A.
Reason: To ensure the development relates satisfactorily to its surroundings, and in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 11 - Prior to the first occupation of the development, details of future proofing to allow connection to a future heat network shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. The details shall include the following information:
- safe-guarding LTHW pipework within the main plant room, terminating at the site boundary;
- allocated space for pipework provision as well as future district heating network plant.
Reason: To ensure compliance with Wandsworth Core Strategy IS 2 and Wandsworth Development Management Policy DMS3 and the London Plan Policy 5.2.

Condition : 12 - Prior to the first occupation of the development, a Mechanical Ventilation Heat Recovery (MVHR) system report in order to mitigate air pollution shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. The report shall include the following information:
a)	Details and locations of the air intake locations of the mechanical ventilation system
or
b)	Details of filtration system to remove airborne pollutants. The filtration system shall have a minimum efficiency of 75% in the removal of Nitrogen Oxides/Dioxides, and Particulate Matter (PM2.5, PM10) in accordance with BS EN ISO 10121-1:2014 and BS EN ISO 16890.
Ventilation intakes shall be positioned a suitable distance away from chimney/boiler flues, ventilation extracts, and roads. The maintenance and cleaning of the systems shall be undertaken regularly in accordance with manufacturer specifications, and shall be the responsibility of the primary owner of the property.  A post installation certificate of the approved ventilation strategy shall be submitted to the Council for approval prior to the occupation/use of the development. Approved details shall be fully implemented prior to the occupation/use of the development and thereafter permanently retained and maintained.
Reason: To manage and prevent further deterioration of existing low quality air across London in accordance with London Plan policy 5.3 and 7.14, and NPPF 103 and 181.

Condition : 13 - No construction shall take place until Information detailing how the developer intends to divert the asset / align the development, so as to prevent the potential for damage to Thames Water's underground assets, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority in consultation with Thames Water. Any construction must be undertaken in accordance with the terms of the approved information. Unrestricted access must be available at all times for the maintenance and repair of the asset during and after the construction works. 
 
Reason: The proposed works will be in close proximity to and has the potential to impact on underground strategic water main and sewerage utility infrastructure. 

Supporting information and informatives:

The proposed development is located within 15 metres of Thames Waters underground assets and as such, the development could cause the assets to fail if appropriate measures are not taken. Please read our guide 'working near our assets' to ensure your workings are in line with the necessary processes you need to follow if you're considering working above or near our pipes or other structures.https://developers.thameswater.co.uk/Developing-a-large-site/Planning-your-development/Working-near-or-diverting-our-pipes. Should you require further information please contact Thames Water. Email: developer.services@thameswater.co.uk Phone: 0800 009 3921 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 5pm) Write to: Thames Water Developer Services, Clearwater Court, Vastern Road, Reading, Berkshire RG1 8DB

The documents submitted indicate that the developer is intending to carry out construction works (demolition, piling, basements, etc) within exclusion zones of Thames Water assets. The developer is required to contact the Thames Water Developer Services department and state that they have been referred to the Asset Protection team by the Development Planning team to discuss the requirements for an asset protection study (0800 009 3921 or b

Condition : 14 - No drainage systems for the infiltration of surface water drainage into the ground are permitted other than with the express written consent of the Local Planning Authority, which may be given for those parts of the site where it has been demonstrated that there is no resultant unacceptable risk to Controlled Waters. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approval details. 
Infiltrating water has the potential to cause remobilisation of contaminants present in shallow soil/made ground which could ultimately cause pollution of groundwater.

Condition : 15 - The development shall be built in accordance with the approved Energy Statement and Sustainability Statement as detailed in - version 02 - XCO2 - Aug 2019, Sustainability Statement - version 02 -XCO2 - Aug 2019 and Sustainability Strategy Review - Responses - XCO2 - 11/02/20  which follow the guidelines set out in Wandsworth Borough Council's 'Sustainability Checklist Appendix 1' ('Energy Assessments: Guidelines for Developers') and demonstrate how the development will follow the hierarchy of energy efficiency, decentralized energy and renewable energy technologies to secure a minimum 35% reduction in CO2 emissions below the maximum threshold set in Building Regulations Part L 2013.
Reason: To ensure compliance with Wandsworth Core Strategy IS 2 and Wandsworth Development Management Policy DMS3.

Condition : 16 - Details of those parts of the site not covered by the building, including any access ways and surface treatment, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the ground floor slab.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
Reason: To ensure a high quality of development and sustainable drainage in compliance with Council policies DMS1 and DMS6 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 17 - Prior to commencement of the commencement of the ground floor slab, details and samples of materials proposed to be used on all external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved materials and thereafter so retained. 
Reason: In order to assess the suitability of the proposed materials, in the interests of the appearance of the locality, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 18 - Details of facilities for people with disabilities, including entrance points and lift access at a scale of 1:50 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the ground floor slab. Such facilities as approved shall be provided prior to the commencement of any of the uses onsite.
Reason: to ensure that disabled people can satisfactorily use the building(s), in accordance with Council policy DMS1(i).

Condition : 19 - Prior to commencement of the ground floor slab. a landscaping scheme to include landscaping and treatment of parts of the site not covered by buildings, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. These details shall include [hard landscaping works including proposed finished levels and contours; car parking layouts; other vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas; hard surfacing materials; the lighting column design, height and material(s); soft landscaping including the species and height of tree planting and root volumes, shrubs, plants and seeding; green/brown roof specification; bat and bird boxes; minor artefacts and structures (e.g. furniture  equipment, refuse or other storage units, signs, lighting); proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (e.g. drainage power; communications cables, pipelines, indicating lines, manholes, supports); retained historic landscape features and proposals for restoration.] The landscaping scheme shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and completed prior to the occupation of the development, or in accordance with a programme agreed in writing with the local planning authority.
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance, provide tree planting and biodiversity improvements, in accordance with Council policies DMS1, DMO4 and DMO5 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. The details are required prior to the commencement of works to ensure the landscaping measures are incorporated in the layout and construction of the development.

Condition : 20 - Within 3 months of work starting on site (excluding demolition), unless otherwise agreed in writing, a BREEAM New Construction Fully Fitted Interim (Design Stage) Certificate (for the hotel, community and caf� areas), issued by the Building Research Establishment (BRE), must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority to show that a minimum Excellent rating will be achieved.
In accordance with policies IS2 and DMS3, and  London Plan policies 5.2 - 5.7.

Condition : 21 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the method statement for the careful taking down, salvage, recording, storage and reconstruction of the club house building alongside detailed drawings (1:50) of the proposed re-built clubhouse cafe detailed in: Method Statement for the taking down, salvage, recording, storage and reconstruction of the Former Bowls Clubhouse to the rear of 111-113 Tooting High Street", by CgMs ref: JCH00582, dated December 2018, Historic Buildings Record - 111-113 Tooting High Street, SW17 by CgMs and Archaeology South East dated August 2018, A-025-010 P0, A-025-011 P0, A-025-012 P0, A-110-050 P0, A-110-051 P0, A-110-052 PL0.
Reason - To ensure the salvage and accurate reconstruction of the historic building to comply with policies DMC1 and DMO1.

Condition : 22 - Details of noise insulation measures to provide effective resistance to the transmission of airborne and impact sound between the proposed D1/D2 and apart-hotel uses along the northern site boundary and 101a Tooting High Street shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The approved measures shall be completed prior to the first occupation of the hotel building.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of residential occupiers, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 23 - Details of proposed boundary treatments, including boundary walls, fences and gates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of use of any part of the development onsite. Such details as may be approved shall be carried out prior to the commencement of any of the uses onsite. 
Reason: To protect visual amenity ensure a satisfactory appearance and in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 24 - Details of green roof measures to be implemented to provide habitat functionality for species known to be found locally shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of use of any part of the development onsite. This should include both landscaping (substrates, substrate depth, species choice and maintenance) and any habitat features that can be accommodated within and on top of the new build structures, including those details in the submitted Ecological Appraisal (prepared by WYG, doc ref: A105415).  Additionally, this should include the depth of soil to the green roof, any landscaping proposals to be accommodated on the roof for visual / amenity purposes . 
Reason: to ensure a satisfactory appearance and  biodiversity value in the development, in accordance with Council policies DMS1 and DMO4. 
Text to be entered

Condition : 25 - Details of ventilation equipment to all proposed commercial kitchens on the site, including ducting, shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of use of any part of the development onsite..
Reason: In the interests of neighbour amenity and visual appearance, and in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 26 - Details of the external lighting scheme shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to its installation. Such facilities as approved shall be provided prior to the commencement of use of any part of the development onsite.
Reason: in the interests of local amenity, and in accordance with Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 27 - The proposed clubhouse reconstruction (for use as an A3 - Caf�) must be completed prior to the occupation of the hotel use. 
Reason: to ensure that this element of the scheme is implemented, and that the historic clubhouse is improved and made ready for use as part of the redevelopment scheme, to comply with policies DMS2, DMC1 and DMO1.

Condition : 28 - All Non Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance 'Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition' dated July 2014 (SPG) or any subsequent guidance. All major development sites in Greater London and all sites within the Central Activity Zone shall keep an inventory on site and on the online register at: https://nrmm.london/ of all NRMM between 37kW and 560kW. All NRMM shall meet Stage IIIA of EU Directive 97/68/EC (as amended) as a minimum within Greater London (Stage IIIB from 1st September 2020) and Stage IIIB of EU Directive 97/68/EC as a minimum within the Central Activity Zone (Stage IV from 1st September 2020).
To achieve appropriate sustainability standards in accordance with policy DMS3 and in accordance with London Plan policies 5.3 and 7.14 and NPPF 103 and 181.

Condition : 29 - Details of any external plant and/or equipment shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to their installation..
Reason: In the interests of neighbour amenity and visual appearance, and in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 30 - Prior to first occupation of the building, unless otherwise agreed in writing, a BREEAM New Construction Fully Fitted Final (Post-Construction) Certificate (for the hotel, community and caf� areas), issued by the BRE, must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that an Excellent rating has been achieved. All the measures integrated shall be retained for as long as the development is in existence.
Reason: To achieve appropriate sustainability standards in accordance with Council policy DMS3 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 31 - Prior to commencement of the use of any part of the development, evidence (e.g. photographs, copies of installation contracts and as-built worksheets prepared under the National Calculation Method) should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority in writing.
Reason: To ensure compliant with policies  IS2 and DMS3.

Condition : 32 - The designated D1/D2 basement and ground floorspace, as shown on the approved plans, shall be used as per class D1 and D2 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 2015 (as amended), or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification, and for no other use for the perpetuity of the development. 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood by ensuring that other uses which could cause a loss of amenity do not commence without prior approval in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 33 - The rebuilt clubhouse space hereby approved and shown on the approved plans shall be used as an cafe under Class A3 and for no other purpose under use Class A (including any other purpose in Class A3 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 2015 (as amended), or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification). 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood by ensuring that other uses which could cause a loss of amenity do not commence without prior approval in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 34 - The Clubhouse Caf� (A3) shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of 07:00 and 19:00 and at no other times.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 35 - The ground floor ancillary restaurant fronting Tooting High Street and associated with the main hotel use shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of 07:00 and 23:00 Monday to Friday, and 07:00 to 22:30 on Sundays, and at no other times.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 36 - No goods, equipment or other materials shall be stored or deposited in any open area of the site/premises. 
Reason: To protect the amenities and appearance of the area. in accordance with Council policy DMS1

Condition : 37 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking, amending or re-enacting that Order), no windows, doors or glazed areas (other than such as may be shown on the approved drawings shall be installed in the approved development.
Reason: To protect the privacy of neighbours and prevent overlooking, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 38 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking, amending or re-enacting that Order) no satellite dishes, telecommunications masts, antennas or equipment or associated structures, shall be installed on the building hereby approved. 
Reason: To protect the appearance of the building, and accord with Council policy DMS9 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 39 - No water tanks, plant, lift rooms or other structures shall be erected upon the roof of the approved building.
Reason: To control the appearance of the building and safeguard the appearance of the area, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 40 - The development hereby approved shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the approved design and construction method statements for all the ground floor structures, foundations and basements and for any other structures below ground level, including piling (temporary and permanent) as detailed in:

- 111-113 Tooting High Street Ground Movement & Crossrail 2 Safeguarding Assessment dated November 2019 ref. 0737-A2S-XX-XX-RP-Y-0001-01 by A-squared Studio Engineers Limited.

- Drawings 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0001 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0002 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-B4-DR-S-0060 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-B3-DR-S-0070 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-B2-DR-S-0080 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-B1-DR-S-0090 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-00-DR-S-0100 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0101 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-01-DR-S-0110 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-02-DR-S-0120 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-03-DR-S-0130 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-04-DR-S-0140 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-05-DR-S-0150 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-06-DR-S-0160 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0200 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0201 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0300 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0301 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0302 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0303 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-0580 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-0600 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-0680 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-D010 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-D020 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-D030 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-L010 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-L020 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-L030 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-T100 Rev P1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-T101 Rev P1.

- Notwithstanding the details as set out in the approved drawings the applicant must also provide the noise and vibration mitigation measures as set out in document 101A - 113 Tooting High Street, London SW17 Vibration Assessment (Planning Stage) dated 26 March 2020 Ref. 9405.RP02.VIB.3 Revision Number 3 by RBA Acoustics.  All structures and works comprised within the development hereby approved design and construction method statements shall be completed, in the

Condition : 41 - The development hereby approved shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the approved detailed design and method statements (in consultation with London Underground) for each stage of the development for all of the demolition, foundations, basement and ground floor structures, or for any other structures below ground level, including piling (temporary and permanent), detailed in:
 
- 111-113 Tooting High Street Ground Movement Assessment Report (London Underground Limited) dated March 2020 ref. 0737-RPT-01-Rev02 by A-squared Studio Engineers Limited. This document has been received/reviewed by LU but has not yet been accepted/approved. The applicant is working with us to satisfy our requirements. LU has requested an amended version of GMA incorporating additional comments which is yet to be submitted. 

- Monitoring proposals to be agreed with LU Engineer.

- Design and Method Statement for all construction phases should be approved by LU Engineer prior to commencement of works.

- Drawings. 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0001 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0002 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-B4-DR-S-0060 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-B3-DR-S-0070 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-B2-DR-S-0080 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-B1-DR-S-0090 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-00-DR-S-0100 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0101 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-01-DR-S-0110 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-02-DR-S-0120 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-03-DR-S-0130 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-04-DR-S-0140 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-05-DR-S-0150 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-06-DR-S-0160 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0200 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0201 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0300 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0301 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0302 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-XX-DR-S-0303 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-0580 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-0600 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-0680 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-D010 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-D020 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-D030 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-L010 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-L020 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-ZZ-DR-S-L030 Rev T1, 2053-HTS-ZZ-Z

Condition : 42 - No properties shall be occupied until confirmation has been provided that either:- all surface water network upgrades required to accommodate the additional flows from the development have been completed; or - a housing and infrastructure phasing plan has been agreed with Thames Water to allow additional properties to be occupied. Where a housing and infrastructure phasing plan is agreed no occupation shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed housing and infrastructure phasing plan. 
Reason: Network reinforcement works are likely to be required to accommodate the
proposed development. Any reinforcement works identified will be necessary in order to avoid flooding and/or potential pollution incidents.

Condition : 43 - There shall be no occupation beyond the 180th hotel room until confirmation has been provided that either:- all water network upgrades required to accommodate the additional flows to serve the development have been completed; or- a development and infrastructure phasing plan has been agreed with Thames Water to allow additional development to be occupied. Where a development and infrastructure phasing plan is agreed no occupation of those additional dwellings shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed development and infrastructure phasing plan.
Reason: The development may low / no water pressures and network reinforcement works are anticipated to be necessary to ensure that sufficient capacity is made available to accommodate additional demand anticipated from the new development

Condition : 44 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
description:
Demolition of existing buildings and redevelopment of the site for a part 3/4/5/6-storey scheme, including 4 storeys of basement level, comprising hotel rooms (Class C1), incorporating the rebuild and repositioning of Tooting Constitutional Clubhouse to be used as a cafe facility (Class A3), community use (Class D1/D2) set out over basement and ground floor levels and publicly accessible open space at ground floor level and ancillary refuse and recycling storage, cycle parking, wheelchair parking, servicing arrangements and hard and soft landscaping.

(The number of 373 hotel rooms (Class C1) will be secured by condition should permission be granted. The amount of 551sq.m for community use (Class D1/D2) will be secured by condition should permission be granted. The amount of 651sq.m for publicly accessible open space at ground floor level will be secured by condition should permission be granted).
